title: "I'm Only Human, Not God": PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath - NDTV
summary:
I'm Only Human, Not God: PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: News Article

In his debut podcast appearance on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's show, Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged his flaws, stating, 'I too can make mistakes.' He comforted Kamath over his Hindi skills, emphasizing their shared understanding.

  • Prime Minister Modi discusses his humanity and the inevitability of mistakes.
  • Nikhil Kamath expresses concerns about his language skills due to his South Indian background.
  • The podcast covers Modi’s childhood, education, and challenges faced in politics.
  • PM Modi actively engages with Kamath, making the dialogue personal and relatable.
  • Modi shared a light-hearted anecdote about his childhood chores.
'Mistakes happen, and I too can make some. I am also a human, not god.' - PM Modi

Modi shared a heartfelt message with listeners, hoping they enjoyed the podcast as much as he did creating it.
newTitle: Prime Minister Modi Reflects on Human Experience in Podcast Debut

PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast, PM Narendra Modi discusses integrity in politics and reflects on his past mistakes.

  • PM Narendra Modi acknowledged his podcast debut, responding, “This is my first podcast, I don't know how it'll go with your audience.”
  • Modi reflected on a previous speech from his tenure as Gujarat's chief minister, stating, “I said something in an insensitive way. Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.”
  • “My first wish when I became CM was to invite all my school friends to CM House,” said PM Modi.
  • “I used to wash the clothes of all my family members. Because of that, I was allowed to go to the pond,” Modi on his childhood.
  • “One should enter politics with a mission, not with ambition,” Modi said.
“Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks a significant moment for PM Modi as he shares insights and encourages integrity and mission-driven participation in politics.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

India-Taliban talks: Region in flux and 5 reasons behind Delhi’s decision to engage Kabul - The Indian Express
summary:
India-Taliban Talks: Region in Flux and 5 Reasons Behind Delhi’s Decision to Engage Kabul

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The meeting between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi highlights India's approach to navigating complex geopolitical dynamics.

  • The meeting underscores India's national and security interests in the region.
  • No official recognition of the Taliban government is being considered yet.
  • Geopolitical shifts in the region are prompting India to engage cautiously.
  • India's humanitarian and development assistance to Afghanistan remains a facet of the discussions.
  • Ongoing concerns about Afghan security and its implications for India.
“This meeting is an effort by India to secure its own national and security interests with many moving parts in play.”

In conclusion, the talks signal India's strategic approach to a changing political landscape and reflect its ongoing commitment to Afghanistan amidst challenges.
newTitle: India-Taliban Talks: Reasons Behind Delhi’s Engagement with Kabul

Supreme Court disallows puja at Sambhal Jama Masjid's well - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Disallows Puja at Sambhal Jama Masjid's Well

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Legal News

An application from the mosque committee was addressed in court, arguing against the Sambhal District administration's proposal to allow public access to a well near the mosque, which the committee claims is being misrepresented as a historical Hindu site.

  • The mosque committee argued that promoting the well as a site for Hindu prayers could disturb local harmony.
  • Senior Advocate Huzefa Ahmadi presented the case, highlighting concerns over the administration's notice referring to the site as Hari Mandir.
  • The Supreme Court issued an interim order to not give effect to the notice until further review.
  • The Court aims to maintain peace and harmony amidst the brewing dispute.
“Opening the same for Hindu prayers will result in mischief and disturb the fragile harmony and peace in the area at the moment.”

This ruling reflects ongoing tensions in the area and emphasizes the Court's role in pre-emptive measures to maintain public order.
newTitle: Supreme Court Disallows Puja at Sambhal Jama Masjid's Well

title: Delhi election: Kejriwal offers to sponsor private guards hired by RWAs in latest poll perk - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Offers to Sponsor Private Guards Hired by RWAs in Latest Poll Perk

Published on January 10, 2025 by HT News Desk

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced a new initiative aimed at securing support in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections by offering financial support for Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) to hire private guards.

  • Arvind Kejriwal announced funding for private security for RWAs if AAP wins the elections.
  • This move is part of a broader strategy to counter anti-incumbency sentiments.
  • Additional welfare schemes announced include a ₹2,100 monthly honorarium for women and free healthcare for the elderly.
  • The elections will take place on February 5, with counting on February 8.
“It is a single-phase election... we have deliberately kept polling on a Wednesday so more people come out to vote,” – CEC Rajiv Kumar.

The upcoming election will be crucial for AAP as it seeks a third consecutive term amid increasing competition from BJP and Congress.
newTitle: Kejriwal Promises Security Perk for RWAs in Delhi Elections

title: BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - SarkariExam.com
summary:
BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025

Date & Source: January 10, 2025 - Bihar School Examination Board

Introduction: The Bihar School Examination Board has invited applications for the Diploma in Elementary Education (D.El.Ed) for 2025. The online registration has commenced and will continue until January 22, 2025.

Key Points:

  • Online Registration started on: January 11, 2025
  • Last Date to Apply: January 22, 2025
  • Application Fee: Rs. 960 for General, EWS, BC, EBC and Rs. 760 for SC, ST, Divyang
  • Minimum Age Requirement: 17 years as of January 1, 2025
  • Course Name: Diploma in Elementary Education, D.El.Ed (2025-27)
  • Eligibility: 12th pass with specific percentage requirements
  • Selection Mode: Based on Online/Written Entrance Examination

“Candidates must check the complete details for BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025.”

Conclusion: Interested candidates should apply online through the official BSEB site and refer to official notifications for further information.

BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 - SarkariExam.com
summary:
BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 Released

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Sarkari Result

Introduction: Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) has announced recruitment for 350 Probationary Engineer positions in Electronics and Mechanical disciplines.

Key Points:

  • Application process started on January 10, 2025.
  • Last date to apply is January 31, 2025.
  • Application fees are Rs. 1180 for General, EWS, OBC; no fee for SC, ST candidates.
  • Age limit: Maximum age of 25 years as of January 1, 2024.
  • A total of 350 posts are available (200 Electronics, 150 Mechanical).
  • Selection will be through a Computer-Based Test (CBT) and interviews.
"Candidates must have BE/B.Tech/B.Sc (Engineering) in Electronics or related disciplines to apply."

For more details, candidates can visit the official website of BEL.
newTitle: BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 Released

title: Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat 2025: Know Date, Parana Timings, Puja Vidhi, Significance and more - Moneycontrol
summary:
Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat 2025: Date, Timings, and Significance

Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Vaikuntha Ekadashi, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, will be observed on January 10, 2025. This day is vital for devotees seeking spiritual salvation.

  • Vrat Date: January 10, 2025
  • Parana Time: 07:15 to 08:21, January 11
  • Dwadashi End Moment: 08:21, January 11
  • Observance Details: Fasting is believed to open the gates to Vaikuntha, leading to salvation.
  • Variability: Depending on lunar calculations, there may be none, one, or twos Vaikuntha Ekadashis in a year.
"The observance of Vaikuntha Ekadashi opens the gates to heaven for devotees who fast with dedication."

In conclusion, Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat offers a sacred opportunity for devotion and renewal of spiritual practices.
newTitle: Vaikuntha Ekadashi Vrat 2025: Date, Timings, and Significance

title: AIIMS opens recruitment for 4000+ non-faculty positions across India - Greater Kashmir
summary:
AIIMS Opens Recruitment for 4000+ Non-Faculty Positions Across India

Date: Not specified
Source: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS)

The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has launched a recruitment drive for over 4,000 Non-Faculty Group-B and Group-C positions. Applications can be submitted through the official AIIMS website until January 31, 2025.

  • Application Process: Opened on January 7, 2025; closes on January 31, 2025, at 5:00 PM.
  • How to Apply: Submit applications online via the official AIIMS website.
  • Vacancies: Roles available include Assistant Dieticians, Data Entry Operators, Medical Lab Technologists, and Pharmacists.
  • Examination Mode: Computer-Based Test (CBT), scheduled for February 26 to 28, 2025.
  • Application Fees: Rs 3,000 (General/OBC), Rs 2,400 (SC/ST/EWS), free for Persons with Disabilities.
"Selected candidates will undergo further evaluations for role-specific competencies."

This recruitment initiative by AIIMS aims to fill crucial positions across various locations in India, enhancing the healthcare workforce.
newTitle: AIIMS Announces Recruitment for Over 4000 Non-Faculty Positions Across India

title: From Assam, a rathole miner’s tale of survival: ‘Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other’ - The Indian Express
summary:
From Assam, a rathole miner’s tale of survival: ‘Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other’

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

In a desperate incident, miners at the 3-Kilo Coal Quarry in Umrangso found themselves trapped due to a sudden influx of water, leading to a tragic scramble for survival.

  • Rajeev Barman entered the mine at 4:30 am seeking work.
  • Previous work at the site had been suspended due to water accumulation.
  • Survivors were pulled out from tunnels amid a chaotic evacuation.
“Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other.”

This incident highlights the perilous conditions faced by miners and the urgent need for safety regulations in hazardous work environments.
newTitle: From Assam, a rathole miner’s tale of survival: ‘Men scrambled out of tunnels and were swept into each other’

title: Clubbing all suits in Krishna Janmabhoomi - Shahi Idgah case benefits both sides: Supreme Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Clubbing all suits in Krishna Janmabhoomi - Shahi Idgah case benefits both sides: Supreme Court

Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court ruled that consolidating all suits related to the Krishna Janmabhoomi - Shahi Idgah case will benefit both Hindu and Muslim parties by preventing multiple proceedings.

  • The Court determined that clubbing all applications would be advantageous for both sides.
  • CJI Sanjiv Khanna questioned the opposition to the consolidation of suits.
  • The case is adjourned and scheduled for a hearing in April 2025.
"No complications at all. It is in your benefit and their benefit also that multiple proceedings are avoided."

This consolidation process aims to streamline proceedings and reduce complications, with the Court indicating a clear path forward.
newTitle: Supreme Court Benefits Both Sides in Krishna Janmabhoomi - Shahi Idgah Case

summary:
Vaikunta Ekadasi 2025: 50+ Wishes, Messages, Images, and Quotes to Share

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Vaikunta Ekadasi, one of the most auspicious days in Hindu tradition, will be celebrated on January 10, 2025, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Devotees fast, pray, and seek divine blessings on this holy day.

Key Points:
  • Ekadashi Tithi Begins: 12:22 PM on January 9, 2025
  • Ekadashi Tithi Ends: 10:19 AM on January 10, 2025
  • Parana Time: 07:16 AM to 08:21 AM on January 11, 2025
  • Dwadashi End Moment: 08:21 AM on January 11, 2025

Breaking the fast on Parana Day is an essential ritual of Ekadasi.

Celebrate with divine blessings of Lord Vishnu.

Vaikunta Ekadasi is a time for reflection and devotion among millions of Hindus.
